Text:
Step 1: Think about how to explain 'nutrition' to someone reading at the Early Elementary level.
Step 2: Select appropriate vocabulary and sentence structure.
Step 3: Write a paragraph of 200 words that follows your plan. Here is the text:
"Nutrition is food that gives us energy to play, learn, and grow. It helps us feel happy and strong. When we eat, our body uses the food to make us healthy and strong. Our bodies are like cars, and food is like gasoline. Just like a car needs gasoline to move, our bodies need food to move and do things. We need food that is good for us, like fruits, vegetables, and whole grains. These foods give us the energy we need to play and have fun. We also need food that has protein, like chicken and fish. Protein helps our bodies grow and fix things when they get hurt. And we need food that has calcium, like milk and cheese. Calcium helps our bones grow strong. Eating the right foods helps us feel our best. When we eat a variety of foods, our bodies get all the energy and nutrients we need to be healthy and strong."

You eat food to have energy for your body. Your body uses that energy to play, run, and have fun. The food you eat has special helpers called nutrients. There are different kinds of nutrients, like vitamins and minerals. These helpers keep you healthy and strong. For example, calcium is a mineral that helps your bones grow strong. Iron is a mineral that helps your blood carry oxygen to all your body parts. If you eat a lot of fruits and vegetables, you will get many of these helpers. You can also get them from other foods like milk and whole grain bread. Eating a variety of foods will give you all the helpers you need. That way, your body can stay healthy and strong.

Text:
Step 1: Think about how to explain 'nutrition' to someone reading at the Early Elementary level.
Step 2: Select appropriate vocabulary and sentence structure.

Nutrition is what our bodies need to stay healthy and strong. Food is the main source of nutrition. It gives us energy to play, learn, and have fun. 
When we eat a variety of foods, our bodies get all the nutrients they need. Fruits, vegetables, and whole grains are examples of healthy foods that are packed with nutrients. 
On the other hand, junk food, candy, and sugary drinks are not good sources of nutrition. They might taste good, but they can make us feel sick and tired. 
Eating a balanced diet is essential for our bodies to function properly. A balanced diet means eating foods from all the food groups. 
Our bodies are like cars, and food is the fuel that keeps them running. When we put the right fuel in our bodies, we feel happy, healthy, and strong.
